definition: lit. iris and orchid/fig. exalted sentiments/(expr. of praise for noble character, beautiful surrounding, future prospects etc)
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
lit. a room with irises and orchids (idiom); fig. in wealthy and pleasant company
lit. orchids and jade trees (idiom); fig. a child with splendid future prospects
Yushu Tibetan autonomous prefecture (Tibetan: yus hru'u bod rigs rang skyong khul) in Qinghai
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
Imperial scholar from the Ming Dynasty onwards
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
